Built with Scalatra

Big organizations

The following companies, public-sector organizations, and governments are using Scalatra:

BBC Future Media

The BBC's Linked Data Team has built a Scalatra REST API for use on the BBC's dynamic web development platform.

Chacha

ChaCha is using it in multiple internal applications.

Gov.uk

The British government is using Scalatra as a router to distribute requests to other back-end apps on its new flagship website.

The Guardian

Scalatra is used in a number of systems that help power The Guardian, for instance the music artist pages.

IGN

IGN is using Scalatra for its backend services.

LinkedIn Signal

LinkedIn Signal is using it in their backend.

Open source projects

Bowler framework

Bowler is a RESTful, multi-channel ready web framework in Scala with a functional flavour, built on top of Scalatra and Scalate, with Lift-JSON doing the heavy JSON lifting. The project is built with Simple Build Tool ("sbt")- we intend to further add custom sbt processors in the future to automate boilerplate tasks.

Fink

Fink is a Scalatra based CMS.

Scalatra toys

scalatra-toys adds parameter binding and command validation support to Scalatra 2.0.x.

Twitter

follow @scalatra

Github

See our GitHub project for issue tracking, or contribute code via a pull request.

Google group

Have a question or need help? Help is close at hand, on the scalatra-user Google Group.
